product_name: DERMA EAcne Deep Pore Salicylic Acid Cleansing Wash
summary: SummaryHighlightsClean IngredientsCruelty FreeVeganSustainable PackagingGive BackHSA/FSA eligibleDerma E's Acne Deep Pore Salicylic Acid Cleansing Wash is a daily cleanser that removes built-up oil and debris to help unclog pores, promotes clear skin and prevent breakouts.
details: DetailsBenefitsPromotes exfoliation of dead skin cells to create a vibrant glowA 4-week consumer trial showed a noticeable reduction in blemishesFeaturesRecyclable & wind energy certifiedFormulated without GMOs, gluten, or soyKey IngredientsSalicylic Acid: This tremendous skin exfoliator helps prevent clogged pores that can cause breakoutsTea Tree Oil: This therapeutic oil can help ease problems caused by a number of skin issuesLavender Oil: A rich oil that nurtures skin to help the complexion look clear and healthyRosewood Oil: Balances skin to promote the appearance of healthy skinWhite Willow Bark Extract: Like Salicylic Acid, White Willow Bark exfoliates skin to keep it clear and help prevent blemishesChamomile Flower Extract: This plant-based ingredient gently soothes skinActive Ingredient: Salicylic Acid 2%Item 2541152How To UsePlace a small amount on a soft cloth and work into a lather. Gently scrub the face and rinse with tepid water.IngredientsActive: Salicylic Acid 2%. Inactive: Purified Water, Disodium Laureth Sulfosuccinate, Cocamidopropyl Hydroxysultaine (Coconut Derived), Cocamidopropylamine Oxide, PEG-150 Distearate, Polysorbate 20, Melaleuca Alternifolia (Tea Tree) Leaf Oil, Glycerin (Vegetable Derived), Lavandula Angustifolia (Lavender) Oil, Aniba Rosodora (Rosewood) Wood Oil, Salix Alba (Willow) Bark Extract, Organic Chamomilla Recutita (Matricaria) Flower Extract*, Decyl Glucoside (Plant Derived), Potassium Sorbate, Phenoxyethanol, Ethylhexylglycerin.
how_to_use: Place a small amount on a soft cloth and work into a lather. Gently scrub the face and rinse with tepid water.
ingredients: Active: Salicylic Acid 2%. Inactive: Purified Water

reviews.headline: Good
reviews.comments: Its working very well so far. It smells like tea tree oil. Which in my opinion does not smell bad.

reviews.headline: I would not buy again
reviews.comments: I haven't been using that long…about 2 weeks once a day. I haven't had any breakouts or over drying on my oil-combo skin. But the smell is HORRIBLE! Smells don't normally bother me, but this one is bad.

reviews.headline: Helping clear up my hormonal acne
reviews.comments: Struggled (still struggling) with hormonal acne, my skin is super sensitive and breaks out in a rash when Ive used other products. I bought this because it was vegan, and im 3 weeks in. Seems to have cleared a lot of my acne, and i havent been breaking out as much as i used to. (especially before a period) Hoping this outcome still lasts. Feels super clean on my skin, and the smell isnt horrible. Cheaper than other cleansers Ive tried, especially because they havent worked as good as this one is seeming to work. I use this cleanser along with the Tula toner + moisturizer. I also recommend the miracle spray.

reviews.headline: Excellent and Affordable
reviews.comments: I felt like this really cleaned my face. I felt squeaky clean. I have sensitive, acne-prone skin and this did not irritate it. I would repurchase.

reviews.headline: Stinks!!!
reviews.comments: This smells so bad i didnt even want it near my face. Dont know if it works well cuz i couldnt get past thr awful smell.

reviews.headline: Amazing. Give it a shot if you suffer from hormonal acne.
reviews.comments: This cleanser has been so amazing to my sensitive, cystic hormonal acne prone skin. I use it in the mornings and at night but the refreshing feeling from the mint and chamomile hits espesially good in the AM. It leaves your face feeling like the pores have truly been cleaned out. My skin has been so clear the past two weeks Ive been using this product!

reviews.headline: game changer
reviews.comments: as a girl who's been struggling with worse acne in her 20s than as a teenager, this cleanser has become my saving grace. in the 3 days i've been using it, my skin is almost entirely clear. my active breakouts are healing, pores are shrinking, and oily skin is *finally* under control. need to go buy all of their products

reviews.headline: great product!
reviews.comments: Other customers are saying it smells bad. While the smell is overwhelming, its good. It smells like essential oils! It leaves my skin feeling very cleansed.

reviews.headline: WOWWWWW
reviews.comments: Let me tell youuuu i havent seen my skin feel & look amazing. Ive been struggling with adult acne, and ive been buying products and after products. But thissssss, i will come back a repurchase. Leaves your skin feeling fresh strong scent (Tea trea oil) but i know my skin is looking at its best.

reviews.headline: WOWWWWW
reviews.comments: Let me tell youuuu i havent seen my skin feel & look amazing. Ive been struggling with adult acne, and ive been buying products and after products. But thissssss, i will come back a repurchase. Leaves your skin feeling fresh strong scent (Tea trea oil) but i know my skin is looking at its best.

reviews.headline: Very happy with this product!
reviews.comments: Ive had very stubborn black heads and sebaceous filaments surrounding my nose and chin. Ive used this product 3 times and have already noticed a significant improvement. I an very happy with this product !!! Will def be my new go to daily cleanser!!

reviews.headline: New cruelty-free fave!
reviews.comments: I used to be a devotee of LaRoche Posay's effaclar cleanser, but I am switching over to entirely cruelty-free products (and preferably not those owned by L'Oreal). I had been searching high and low for a cleanser with salicylic acid, and lo and behold Derma E fit the bill! I love how this cleanser feels on my hands and it treats my sensitive, acne-prone skin with care. Highly recommend for us oily folks prone to breakouts!

reviews.headline: On my 2nd bottle
reviews.comments: I started getting bad breakouts in my mid-30s and tried a few different acne cleansers that would work initially but then stop. This cleanser worked immediately and has kept my skin clear for months. Im on my second bottle (which is large enough to last) and will keep buying this. I enjoy the tea tree smell and the feel of thr product.

reviews.headline: I use this everyday!
reviews.comments: This keeps my acne at bay when I use it daily. I have combination skin, and it makes my face feel smooth and soft along with keeping the oil from getting out of control while getting rid of blemishes

reviews.headline: PART OF MY DAILY SKINCARE ROUTINE
reviews.comments: I recommend this product. I have used it for about a year and it has helped me. It has helped clear my acne and it has helped my oily skin. It has maked my face feel cleaner and look cleaner.

reviews.headline: Part of my daily skincare routine for 3 years and counting
reviews.comments: I absolutely LOVE this cleansing wash. It has worked so well with my acne prone/hyperpigmentation skin that other cleansers didn't. I incorporate this cleanser with the scar gel and acne blemish serum (I include the Vitamin C serum for my nightly routine). I sing its praises to anyone and everyone!

reviews.headline: Great, effe time product, but took away 1 star...
reviews.comments: This cleanser is very effective in cleansing my face without stripping it.  It is helping corral my tiny breakouts that I had been getting.  I HAD to knock off one star for the overwhelming tea tree scent.  The other reviews were correct: It's so strong that it almost smells like gardening chemicals.  It doesn't bother me so much, but don't get this if you're sensitive to fragrance whatsoever.

reviews.headline: On my 3rd bottle
reviews.comments: Haven't had a pimple since I started using it.

reviews.headline: Happiness in a bottle.
reviews.comments: After so many years trying to find the right face wash for my skin(super deep pores) I've finally found what works and this is it :)

reviews.headline: mediocre product
reviews.comments: Honestly this is a pretty low-quality cleanser when you consider its price and the quantity. It has a really strong tea tree smell and i personally feel like it doesn't really cleanse my face thoroughly. There's way better cleansers out there that cost less.

media.headline: This got rid of my acne!
media.caption: Healthy clear skin 2 weeks later

media.headline: Broke me out
media.caption: I know it's only one big one and a few little ones. But it's a lot for me!

faceoff_positive.comments:
I have tried so many products throughout the years. I've had acne since I was 13 and I'm in my late 20s now. Trust me, this product is amazing. I have sensitive skin but I hate buying all those "natural, organic, sensitive skin" etc products because they do absolutely nothing. My skin has cleared up A LOT over a period of 2 weeks with this derma-e cleanser and it actually looks like healthy skin!

I use one or two pumps of this product and just lather it on my face at night before bed or after a long day of being out to remove all of my makeup. I lather and massage it for about 3 minutes then just rinse and pat dry. Maybe two or three times a week I use an electronic cleanser brush with a pump or two of the derma-e and just hold the wet spin brush for about 15-20 seconds until I have cleansed my entire face then pat dry. In the mornings I only rinse my face with cool water and pat dry, unless I feel that my skin is too oily, then I just use a half pump and lather it on my face and pat dry then apply moisturizer.

I follow this up with a lactic acid serum for acne treatment and jelly moisturizer or only the moisturizer depending how my skin is doing that day. 

I don't like using oil free moisturizers (or oil free products in general) because I notice that those make my acne worse. 

Also the smell is not horrible. It just smells like witch hazel, so if you don't like that smell, you probably won't like this.
faceoff_positive.headline: This got rid of my acne!

faceoff_negative.comments:
I struggle with hormonal acne and breakout primarily along my jaw, the sides of my face, and on my temples. I really wanted to love this product because it was vegan and cruelty free, but my face said NOPE. The first few days were fine, and I thought I noticed a reduction in the redness of my skin. But soon, I had broken out literally EVERYWHERE. Even on parts of my face that don't get acne. It produced three extremely painful cysts along my right temple, a myriad of comedones and bumps on my forehead, and more painful cysts on my cheeks. Of course, I figured I was purging. So I kept trying, using this facewash twice a day for around two weeks. And it just. Kept. Getting. Worse. It got to the point where my face was so inflamed that I hated looking at my appearance.

Keep in mind that I don't have sensitive skin, and I didn't change anything else in my routine. I was shocked at how bad the breakout was, so I stopped using the facewash immediately. Fast forward two weeks later and a switch back to Cetaphil, and my face is finally getting back on track. The cysts are still healing and will probably leave scars due to how prominent they were, and I still have texture all over my face.

While this product may have worked for others, it definitely did not work for me. Everyone's skin is different, so all I can say is try at your own risk. 

Also, side note, the smell wasn't necessarily bad. But I hated washing my face and knowing that I was putting so many unnecessary essential oils and fragrances on my already acne-prone skin. Do yourself a favor and try to find a better alternative that doesn't rely on essential oils like Derma-E.
faceoff_negative.headline: Made me breakout TERRIBLY

rollup.name: Acne Deep Pore Salicylic Acid Cleansing Wash
